column3: Definition
column4: Rationale/Use
column5: Risk of Change

column3: The codes identify the conditions under which accept acknowledgements are required to be returned in response to this message. Note that accept acknowledgement address two different issues at the same time: reliable transport as well as syntactical correctness.
column4: Required for message transport.
column5: None - codes exist and are unlikely to change.

column3: A site specific code indicating the specific problem being reported by this Ack Detail.
column4: By providing coded identification of issues and errors, allows applications to have logic that manages particular errors and warnings automatically.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: A code distinguishing between errors, warnings and information messages related to the transmission of the message
column4: Distinguishes between errors, warnings and information messages.
column5: None - codes exist and are unlikely to change.

column3: This attribute contains an acknowledgement code as described in the HL7 message processing rules.
column4: Essential to indicating whether or not the message was successfully received.
column5: None - codes exist and are unlikely to change.

column3: Types of representation groupings of financial transactions that are tracked and reported together with a single balance.
column4: Used to provide information on adjudication result. Includes coded responses that will occur as a result of the adjudication of an electronic invoice.  Information supplied may or may not be directly related to the adjudication result with which the code is supplied.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Actions to be carried out by the recipient of the Adjudication Result information.
column4: Informs the recipient of the Adjudication Results what, if any, action has to be applied to the results. E.g.: specify a URL to instruct the Drug software vendor to pick up the form from the adjudicator's web site.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Types of responses that will occur as a result of the adjudication of an electronic invoice at a summary level and provides guidance on interpretation of the referenced adjudication results.
column4: Used to specify codes explaining the adjudication decision and benefits provided.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Describe why an antigen is considered to be invalid.
column4: Provides additional context around an antigen's invalidity.  This is not expected to be present when an antigen is valid and as such is considered a required attribute.
column5: High - concept domain and value set requires harmonization with HL7 international.

column3: May be sent to indicate one or more reasons for the performance of a billable clinical service or product, and not related or specified by a diagnosis.
column4: Used to explain the clinical need for the service being billed.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: Types of provision(s) made for reimbursing for the deliver of healthcare services and/or goods provided by a Provider for one or more occurrence or over a specified period.
column4: Identifies the type of provision made for reimbursement of the healthcare services provided over a specific period. For example, Capitation Funding or Fee For Service.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: Codes identifying types or categories of a care composition (i.e. encounter, outpatient encounter, emergency encounter, day surgery encounter, short visit encounter, episode or care event).
column4: Used for searching and for organizing care composition records as well as sorting them for presentation.
column5: Moderate - Harmonization proposal is required for concept domain under root ActCode and parent HL7DefinedActCodes.

column3: Concepts identifying different types of referral requests.  These codes identify the general type of care or category of services requested.  They are not used to represent the indication or diagnosis which triggered the need for the referral.
column4: Used for categorizing and searching.
column5: High - aspects of this concept domain (e.g. definition) will be added or revised post MR 2009 via communication with the impacting SCWG(s).

column3: Constrains the type of attachment (document, XRAY, bit map image, etc.) included to support a healthcare claim. Vocabulary bound to this domain should be a specification for the type of document (i.e. WCB First Report of Accident - Form 8).
column4: Identifies the type of claim-supporting material attached.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: Lists of high-level categorizations for clinical coded observations that do not require numeric values with a specific unit of measure.
column4: It is used to categorize observations for presentation. E.g. signs and symptoms, history observations. By associating categories, a person viewing the EHR information can first look at a list of categories and then drill down to the specific observation. The presence of this field is essential to prevent users from being overwhelmed.
column5: Moderate - concept domain will be renamed to ActCommonCodedClinicalObservationCategoryListType.

column3: Indicates why the information is being accessed.
column4: Tracks reasons for overriding consent.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Defines for what action (from a privacy perspective) consent is being granted, withheld, or withdrawn.
column4: Allows support for information access, information recording and other forms of consent.
column5: Moderate - value set contains temporarily defined content and will be harmonized with a permanent code system such as HL7.

column3: Identifies what type of issue detected during occurrence of an act (e.g. unrecognized identifiers, drug-drug contraindications, drug-allergy alerts).
column4: Allows for consistency in conveying detected issues.
column5: Moderate - Harmonization proposal is required for code(s).

column3: Codes dealing with the management of Detected Issue observations.
column4: Allows for consistent specification and interpretation of issue management.
column5: Moderate - Harmonization proposal is required for concept domain and code(s).

column3: Contains a set of coordinated information related to a diagnosis or health condition.  When not conveying SNOMED CT® codes, represents a fixed value.
column4: Allows conveying all diagnosis-related information as part of a single field for SNOMED CT®.
column5:
High - The specific rules for which SNOMED CT® codes should be pre-coordinated into the "code" attribute and which should be left in more discrete attributes is still being determined.  Also, the question of whether SNOMED CT® concepts should be sent as pre-coordinated or post-coordinated needs to be resolved.

Harmonization proposal is required for concept domain.

column3: List of broad categorization of clinical event records.
column4: Allows for the filtering of clinical summary/profile information based on broad category of clinical records.
column5: Moderate - concept domain will be renamed to ActEventCategoryWorkingListType.

column3: Identifies the type of health condition being represented.
column4: Allows capturing health conditions as coded information.
column5: High - Harmonization proposal is required for concept domain. Value set will likely to change over time.

column3: Reasons why an immunization was administered.
column4: Value set concepts chosen based on CIRN recommendations and expressed in SNOMED CT terms.
column5: Moderate - value set may change over time.

column3: Identifies codes describing the reason for an act.
column4: Allows querying by indication as a single code.
column5: Moderate - Harmonization proposal is required for concept domain.

column3: The type of health information to which the subject of the information or the subject's delegate consents or dissents.
column4: Allows more fine-grained control of access to information.
column5: Moderate - value set may change over time.

column3: Indicates the set of information types which may be manipulated or referenced, such as for recommending access restrictions.
column4: Allows the masking of categories of information rather than just individual records.
column5: Moderate - value set contains one temporarily defined concept and will be harmonized with a permanent code system such as HL7.

column3: Information types for which a provider is requesting routing of health information.  This could include messaging of results or documents especially in the context of a specific service delivery location.  Examples include documents from the specific service delivery location to them.  Examples could include Diagnostic Image Interpretations, Lab Test Results, Electrocardiogram Reports.
column4: Allows providers to request that specific document(s) be routed from an SDL to them.
column5: High - concepts are temporarily defined and will be moved to a permanent code system such as HL7 or SNOMED CT®.

column3: Types of insurance coverage legal documentation to cover healthcare costs.
column4: Used to identify the type of coverage the policy provides.  For example: Health Spending Account.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: Types of grouping of invoice elements (totals, sub-totals), reported through a Payment Advice or a Statement of Financial Activity (SOFA). The code can represent summaries by day, location, payee and other cost elements such as bonus, retroactive adjustment and transaction fees.
column4: Used for Payment Advice/SOFA message models.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: Codes representing a service or product that is being invoiced (billed). The code can represent such concepts as "office visit", "drug X", "wheelchair" and other billable items such as taxes, service charges and discounts.
column4: Used to specify exact type of product or service being invoiced.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Types of tax associated with billable services or products.
column4: Used to specify taxes as part of billable items; captured for audit purposes.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Types of summary information that can be reported by queries dealing with Statement of Financial Activity (SOFA). The summary information is generally used to help resolve balance discrepancies between providers and payors.
column4: Identifies the different types of summary information that can be reported by queries dealing with Statement of Financial Activity (SOFA).  The summary information is generally used to help resolve balance discrepancies between providers and payors.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3:
Type of invoice element that is used to assist in describing an Invoice that is either submitted for adjudication or for which is returned on adjudication results. 

Invoice elements of this type signify a grouping of one or more children (detail) invoice elements. They do not have intrinsic costing associated with them, but merely reflect the sum of all costing for it's immediate children invoice elements.
column4: This is used to describe the type of Invoice Grouping. Information on constraints for the Invoice Type will be found in the Claims Message Specifications.  Each Benefit Group will indicate which Invoice Types will be supported by that Benefit Group.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: Types of responses that will occur as a result of the adjudication of an electronic invoice at a summary level and provides guidance on interpretation of the referenced adjudication results.
column4: Reason or rationale for an Invoice Element is over ridden. Some overrides will require a text note component to fully explain the override. If an adjudicator does not support the override (e.g. repeated service), the override code should not be ignored. The Invoice Grouping should likely be refused with a message "we don't support this type of override".
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Indicates the relative importance or priority of a detected issue.
column4: Allows sorting of issues in displays, as well as mapping issue information.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: The unique identifier for the drug or chemical.
column4: Allows un-ambiguous identification of the ingredients of a drug for performing various alert checking.
column5: Moderate - Value set qualifiers to be defined post MR2009.

column3: Indicates types of medication documents that can be retrieved.
column4: Allows identification of what type of document should be returned from a DIS.  Also indicates what uses a given document is appropriate for.
column5: High - concepts are temporarily defined and will be harmonized with LOINC®.

column3: Identifies types of monitoring programs such as tracking specified medication prescribing e.g. narcotic(s), identifying investigational studies or identifying programs regarding reimbursement or prescribing privileges.
column4: Distinguishes various types of controlled substances and other monitoring programs.
column5:
Low - minimal changes expected.

Harmonization proposal for concept domain is required.

column3: Reasons why a patient did not receive an immunization.
column4: Ensures that reasons for not receiving an immunization are gathered in a consistent and analyzable manner.
column5: Moderate - value set contains concepts temporarily defined and will need to be harmonized with a permanent code system such as SNOMED CT®.

column3: Codes representing indications other than diagnosis and indications (e.g. contrast agents for lab tests)
column4: Ensures consistent gathering of indication information for comparison and analysis.
column5: Moderate - Harmonization proposal is required for concept domain.

column3: Provides a categorization for annotations recorded directly against the patient.
column4: Allows filtering of what notes different provider types can (or may want to) access.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Identifies types of dispensing events
column4: Used for categorization, and may also explain deviations from prescribed quantity or other business rule deviations.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: A set of codes (e.g., for routine, emergency), specifying the urgency under which the Act happened, can happen, is happening, is intended to happen, or is requested/demanded to happen.
column4: Codes identifying the priority of the Observation.
column5: High - aspects of this concept domain (e.g. definition) will be added or revised post MR 2009 via communication with the impacting SCWG(s).

column3: Observations used to characterize a privilege, under which this additional information is classified.
column4: Supports the validation and identification of the healthcare provider and his/her given privileges.
column5:
High - value set content to be developed.

Harmonization proposal for concept domain definition is required.

column3: Describes the high level classification of professional services for grouping.
column4: Allows categorizing professional services for presentation.
column5: Moderate - value set may change over time.

column3:
Financial Acquisition Terms: categorizations of acquisition terms for a product. 

Types of method a product can be obtained for use by the subject of the supply act (e.g. patient). Product examples are consumable or durable goods.
column4: The method that a product is obtained for use by the subject of the supply act (e.g. patient).  Product examples are consumable or durable goods.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Denotes the specific service that has been performed. This is obtained from the professional service catalogue pertaining to the discipline of the health service provider.
column4: Ensures consistency in capturing professional service information.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: Concepts representing the categorization of health services available at a particular delivery location site.
column4: Used for searching and for organizing service delivery location records, as well as sorting them for presentation.
column5:
Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

Harmonization proposal for concept domain is required.

column3: A high-level categorization for clinical non-laboratory and non-diagnostic image measured observations with numeric values and specific units of measure.
column4: Used to categorize the types of measured observations for easy presentation and drill-down.
column5:
High - concepts are temporarily defined and will be harmonized with a permanent code system like LOINC®.

Concept domain will be renamed to ActSimpleMeasurableClinicalObservationCategoryListType.

column3: Codes representing the defined states of an Act as defined by the Act class state machine.
column4: Used for status of prescriptions, dispenses, allergies, etc.
column5: None - codes exist and are unlikely to change.

column3: Describes the type of substance administration being performed.
column4: Helps understand the type of record being displayed and distinguishes between the administration of vaccines from other types of drugs.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Identifies the types of substitution that may be permitted when ordering a medication, as well as those which have actually occurred during the act of dispensing.
column4: Filters the set of substitution codes to those allowed for pharmacy.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Indicates why a fulfiller refused to fulfill a supply order, and considered it important to notify other providers of their decision
column4: Captures "refusal to fill" reasons in a consistent way.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Contains a set of coordinated information describing a symptom.  When not conveying SNOMED CT® codes, represents a fixed value.
column4: Allows conveying all symptom information as part of a single field for SNOMED CT®.
column5:
High - The specific rules for which SNOMED CT® codes should be pre-coordinated into the "code" attribute and which should be left in more discrete attributes is still being determined.  Also, the question of whether SNOMED CT® concepts should be sent as pre-coordinated or post-coordinated needs to be resolved.

Harmonization proposal for concept domain and concepts is required.

column3: Codes used to identify different types of 'duration-based' working lists.  Examples include "Continuous/Chronic", "Short-Term" and "As-Needed".
column4: Ensures consistent capturing of duration-based categories for a prescription.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Specifies that an act statement is made with or without an assertion of uncertainty. Codes used in conveying to other Health Service Providers, the level of confidence to be placed in a patient’s recorded medical condition.
column4: Used to flag prescriptions as 'uncertain' because their information has been inferred from a dispense event.
column5: None - codes exist and are unlikely to change.

column3:
Indicates the form in which the drug product should be administered.
Usage: This element only needs to be specified when (a) the form in which the drug is measured for dispensing differs from the form in which the drug is administered
column4: Allows capturing of dosage units that differ from units of measurement and the dosage form.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Indicates the primary purpose or type of person intended to be reached using a set of contact information. I.e. the categories that may be displayed in a phone directory listing.  E.g. Admitting, billing, after-hours, etc.
column4: Helps users decide which set of contact information should be used at particular circumstances.
column5:
Moderate - value set contains temporarily defined concepts which requires to be harmonized with a permanent code system like HL7.

Harmonization proposal for concept domain is required.

column3: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes (as opposed to clinical gender)
column4: Ensures consistency in gender for identification matching, and contraindication checking.
column5: None - codes exist and are unlikely to change.

column3: Indicates the result of a particular allergy test
column4: Ensures consistent gathering of test results for filtering, analysis purposes.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: A role type that is used to further qualify an entity playing a role where the role class attribute is set to RoleClass AssignedEntity.
column4: Supports the identification of the healthcare provider
column5: High - value set content is temporarily defined and will be harmonized with a permanent code system such as SNOMED CT®.

column3: Identifies the detailed record type of any record in the EHR.
column4: Allows searching by detailed record type in a cross-domain query.
column5: High - concept domain to be harmonized with HL7 international. Value set will likely to change over time.

column3: A very general category for a document that summarizes a Care Composition.
column4: Used to convey what sort of document is being represented.
column5: Moderate - Harmonization proposal is required for concept domain.

column3: A coded value denoting drug identification at various levels of abstraction. Examples include identification system for manufactured drug product, generic formulation, generic, and therapeutic class.
column4: Used to ensure clear communication by uniquely identifying a particular drug product when prescribing or dispensing.
column5:
Moderate - Value set qualifiers to be defined post MR2009.

Harmonization proposal is required for concept domain.

column3: General categories of Observation Documents.
column4: Used to convey what sort of document is being represented.
column5:
Moderate - value set contains temporarily defined concept which will be harmonized with a permanent code system such as LOINC®.

Harmonization proposal is required for concept domain.

column3: A more detailed type of clinical content contained in the document.
column4: Used for categorization and searching.
column5:
Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

Harmonization proposal for concept domain is required.

column2:
Prescription Order Suspend Reason
(Part of Activity Reason hierarchy)
column3: Indicates why the prescription should be suspended.
column4: Trigger-event specific reason codes.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: The non-laboratory, non-diagnostic imaging coded observation if no value is also required to convey the full meaning of the observation. This may be a single concept code or a complex expression.
column4: Sub-domain for observation concepts that represent the entire observation idea without the need for a "result" value.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3:
The non-laboratory, non-diagnostic imaging coded (non-numeric) result of the coded observable or “question” represented by the paired concept from the  NonLabDICodedObservationType domain. 
Examples include an APGAR result, a functional assessment, etc. The value must not require a specific unit of measure.
column4: Sub-domain for observation concepts that represent only "coded result" concepts for observations (as represented in the Coded Observation Type domain).
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: Used in a patient care message to value simple clinical (non-lab) observations.
column4: Allows for capturing a single observation concept or the result of an observation that requires a coded result.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: Represents the components of a coded clinical observation.  E.g. individual components of an APGAR score
column4: Allows for searching and comparison of complex coded observations.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: Represents observations for components of a clinical coded observation.  E.g. results for individual components of an APGAR score
column4: Allows for searching and comparison of complex coded observation values.
column5:
Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

Harmonization proposal for concept domain is required.

column3: Identifies the type for a clinical observation whose value is expressed as a code. E.g. Home support level
column4: Used for searching and filtering.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: A container intended to contain sufficient material for more than one use, but grouped or organized to provide individual access to sufficient material for a single use. Often used to ensure that the proper type and amount of material is consumed/expended for each use.
column4: Many insurance plans require that a prescriber specifically authorize the use of compliance packaging before it will be covered by the plan.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: The type of cap associated with a container.
column4: Used for drug safety measure and also as convenience in certain patient population.
column5: None - codes exist and are unlikely to change.

column3: A code that specifies how an ActRelationship or Participation contributes to the context of an Act, and whether it may be propagated to descendent Acts whose association allows such propagation (see also attributes Participation.contextControlCode, ActRelationship.contextControlCode, ActRelationship.contextConductionInd).
column4: Allows for specifying the way in which participant and/or other group of information is to be  consistently referenced in an message model.
column5: None - codes exist and are unlikely to change.

column3: Indicates why the specific transaction should be undone.
column4: Trigger-event specific reason codes.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: Indicates why a specific transaction which was requested to be undone; was not undone
column4: Trigger-event specific reason codes.
column5: High - concept domain and value set requires harmonization with HL7 international.

column3: Identifies why this specific query, modification request, or modification occurred.
column4: Ensures consistent capturing of reasons for holds, releases, stops, etc.
column5: As per constituent domains.

column3: A role recognized through the eligibility of an identified living subject for benefits covered under an insurance policy or a program. Eligibility as a covered party may be conditioned on a relationship with (1) the policy holder such as the policy holder who is covered as an individual under a policy or as a party sponsored for coverage by the policy holder.
column4: The covered party relationship to the Policy Holder; For Invoice and Pre-Determination Request & all Results: Mandatory, otherwise Required.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: To be used to code and identify the Microbiology laboratory result  observation “question”.
column4: When associated with the Culture attribute of the model – it will act as the Microbiology orderable observation.  When associated with the CultureObservationEvent attribute it will be used for observations such as gram stain on the specimen (as opposed to the isolate) or when the observation is associated with a textual response such as “no growth” (as opposed to a coded microorganism).  When associated with the OrganismIdentificationEvent attribute – it will identify the observation when one or more microorganisms must be reported (in MicroorganismCode – as the result value)
column5: Moderate - harmonization proposal is required for concept domain.

column3: Used to code and identify the Microbiology laboratory result value when a coded result is reported.
column4: This Concept Domain is used with the CultureObservationEvent attribute to report coded results of a gram stain on the specimen (as opposed to the isolate).
column5:
High - value set content to be developed.

Harmonization for concept domain is required.
column12: Filters to be defined by SCWG 5 and its stakeholders.

column3: A medical condition found to be present in a subject.
column4: Ensures consistent capturing of indications and patient conditions for contraindication checking.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: Concepts that represent sections of clinical documents of any type.
column4: Allows for filtering and ordering sections within a document.
column5: Moderate - value set contains temporarily defined concepts which will be harmonized with a permanent code system such as LOINC®.

column3: Selected concepts that align with reportable discharge designations.
column4: Used by public health for analysis of encounter information.
column5: High - value set likely to change over time with analysis from CIHI.

column3: Risk associated with the handling of the material.
column4: An important alert/precautionary information to healthcare providers in the provisioning of healthcare services.
column5:
High - aspects of this concept domain (e.g. definition) will be added or revised post MR 2009 via communication with the impacting SCWG(s).

Harmonization proposal for concept domain definition is required.

column3: Indicates the material to which the patient was exposed which is believed to be related to the adverse reaction.
column4: Allows linking a reaction to a drug or other substance.
column5: As per constituent domains.

column3: The type of relationship between the patient and another individual. Examples include: Father, Mother, Uncle.
column4: Used for Claims purposes.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Identifies why a change is being made to a patient's record.
column4: Trigger-event specific reason codes.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

column3: A role of a place that further classifies the clinical setting (e.g., cardiology clinic, primary care clinic, rehabilitation hospital, skilled nursing facility) in which care is delivered during an encounter.
column4: Helps identify the type of organization on whose behalf action was taken, and provides context to the action.
column5:
Moderate - value set likely to change over time.

The value set is under review with potential new concepts be added from the PHS Immunization topic.
column12: Pending value set merge with Immunization review to take place.

column3: A role type that is used to categorize an entity that delivers health care in an expected and professional manner to an entity in need of health care services. Examples: Registered Nurse, Chiropractor, Physician, Custodial Care Clinic.
column4: Allows for the implementation of role-based access to clinical functions and data. Provisioning of clinical services is based on the role that a provider may play in the health system.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Indicates the version of the HL7 messaging standard being referenced. This is the domain of HL7 version codes for the Version 3 standards. Values are to be determined by HL7 and added with each new version of the HL7 Standard.
column4: Needed to know how to validate message definition, CMET definition, vocabulary and other information. Each release will only support one standard version code.
column5: None - new codes will be added for each version of HL7 standards.

column3: The trigger event referenced by the Control Act instance.
column4: Identifies the trigger event that occurred. Values are drawn from the available trigger events used in the release of HL7 identified by the versionCode. This is essential to understanding the meaning of the event.
column5: Moderate - value set likely to change over time.
column12: This includes all codes from the Trigger Events tab of the implemented scope and tracking frameworks as well as any trigger events from other implemented jurisdictional or international specifications.

column3:
To be used to code the anatomic component of the human-sourced specimen that the lab observation relates to.
Examples include:
386802000 endometrial biopsy
309146009 thyroid fine needle aspirate sample
column4: Provides specimen information if the LOINC record does not contain sufficient information about the specimen in the 'System' component.
column5: Moderate - More analysis is required for a more precise filter for this value set.

column3: A coded value denoting a specific language in which the monograph is written.
column4: Allows providers to request or display information in the language of their choice.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: The set of body locations to or through which a drug product may be administered.
column4: Provides ease-of-entry when specifying administration sites.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Codes to specify the scope in which the identifier applies to the object with which it is associated, and used in the datatype property II.use.
column4: Use to communicate the type of identifier in the data types specification.
column5:
High - value set very likely change with adoption of Data types R2 with a property named "scope" instead of "use" and have different codes.
Current concepts are temporarily defined and will be moved to a permanent code system like HL7.

column3: Used to represent the patient's status with respect to their immunization guideline as of an evaluation date.
column4: Required to indicate to a provider if a patient is up to date with their immunizations according to the schedule and is therefore mandatory.
column5: Moderate - value set may change over time.

column3: Codes used in observations which describe characteristics of the immunization material.  Examples are antigen count, antigen validity, and antigen type.
column4: Used to communicate characteristics of the immunizing agent.
column5:
Moderate - value set may change over time.

Harmonization is required for concept domain.

column3: Indicates types of non-dedicated service delivery locations. E.G. Patient Residence, Community Location, School, etc.
column4: Allows for the general categorization of non-dedicated locations at which services may be delivered.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: Indicate the type of case safety report.
column4: Required to indicate to a provider if a patient is up to date with their immunizations according to the schedule and is therefore mandatory.
column5: Moderate - value set may change over time.

column3: Codes identifying allergens and other agents which cause allergies and intolerances.
column4: Ensures consistent capturing of allergy information for triggering of contraindications.
column5: As per constituent domains.

column3:
To be used in the message when there is a requirement to communicate a result observation code that relates to a specific isolate.
Example: 19090-0 Colony count
column4: Ensures consistent capturing of information pertaining to the isolate.
column5: Moderate - Harmonization proposal is required for concept domain.

column3: Indicates how result sets should be filtered based on whether they have associated unmanaged or persistent issues.
column4: Allows for the categorization of criteria to be used in filtering query responses.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.

column3: The combined domain for different types of coded observation issue triggers, such as diagnoses, allergies, etc.

column3:
A code that provides additional detail about the means or technique used to ascertain the observation.

Examples: Blood pressure measurement method: arterial puncture vs. sphygmomanometer (Riva-Rocci), sitting vs. supine position, etc. 

Constraints: In all observations the method is already partially specified by the Act.code. In this case, the methodCode NEED NOT be used at all. The methodCode MAY still be used to identify this method more clearly in addition to what is implied from the Act.code. However, an information consumer system or process SHOULD NOT depend on this methodCode information for method detail that is implied by the Act.code.
column4: Allows other/downstream providers to make informed decisions on the interpretation and validity of an observation.

column3:
This describes which path the administered medication takes to get into the body or into contact with the body and constitutes part of the "where" (the other part being site - see below). It is the "way in" or the course the medication must take to get to its destination. Note that a path is in no sense a description of a "final destination"; it is a stylized description of the path taken. For example, an oral antibiotic may be used to treat a severe infection on a toe; the oral route is used to get the medicine to be able to reach and treat the infection in the toe. For some specific routes of administration, there may be an incidental sense of "final destination", for example an ocular administration usually occurs when treatment of an eye condition is required. However, this is in no sense definitional: rectal administration of a medicine may be for a local effect (a steroid foam for treatment of colitis) or for a systemic effect (metronidazole for treatment of infection). The route of administration of a medicine should only be a description of the path taken and not the form.

Examples of routes of administration: oral, rectal, ocular, intravenous (IV), subcutaneous (SC), intramuscular (IM)
column4: Ensures consistency in description of routes. Provides potential for cross-checking dosage form and route.
column5: Low - minimal changes expected.
